newsitem.title: NORWAY: ALPINE SKIING-FAN HURT AS HIGH WINDS DISRUPT WORLD CUP RACE.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-FAN HURT AS HIGH WINDS DISRUPT WORLD CUP RACE.

text.p: A spectator was hurt as high winds delayed the start of a men's Alpine ski World Cup downhill race on Saturday.
The gusting winds blew over a scoreboard in the finish area, injuring a spectator who was taken by ambulance to hospital in Lillehammer with a suspected broken back.
The start of the race was put back twice with organisers saying they hoped it would finally go ahead at 1200 GMT.
The penultimate downhill of the season has been disrupted by bad weather all week, limiting the skiers to just one practice session on the Olympiabakken course.
Rain forced the cancellation of final training on Friday.
